column4: Installed a package never deletes another package.  If you install two packages that contain drivers (modules they're called in linux) then the system will choose one to use at boot time.  You can manually switch them around yourself using modprobe :)
People suggest having only 1 module on a system for any piece of hardware so that you don't have to play guessing games with the kernel about which one the system is going to use.
Does your how-to say how?  rainwalker says it's step 1.
That doesn't matter.  We'll help you :)
